info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Larimer and northeastern Boulder Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 710 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pinewood Springs, or 28 miles southwest of Fort Collins, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Western Longmont, Lyons, Jamestown, Raymond, Pinewood Springs, Peaceful Valley and Allenspark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
